main event: Multiple witnesses reported seeing a bright, yellow, round object that moved in a steady arc and blinked in the sky over Saratoga Springs, New York.
interesting points: The object was described as larger than a star and had an extreme yellow glow.
The object was first seen at 270 degrees and moved to 025 degrees, covering a steady arc.
Astronomical phenomena, weather conditions, and aircraft were ruled out as possible explanations.
The report was evaluated as insufficient data due to having only one witness.
